object_work_type: commemorative plaques plaques (flat objects) commemorative plaques plaques (flat objects)
physical_appearance: "The image shows a commemorative plaque. It is rectangular in shape and it has a grey background. There are inscriptions on the front of the commemorative plaque, relating to the death of ""Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes"" and her contributions to the ""Sandes Soldiers' Home""." "The image shows a commemorative plaque. It is rectangular in shape and it has a grey background. There are inscriptions on the front of the commemorative plaque, relating to the death of ""Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes"" and her contributions to the ""Sandes Soldiers' Home""."
sgcool_label_text: "This plaque was built by former British servicemen in memory of the founder of the Sandes Soldiers Home in Singapore, Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes. The Home, orignally located at Portsdown Road where The Temasek Club used to be, was opened in 1949. With facilities such as a swimming pool, canteen, tennis courts and a billiards room, the Home provided a recreational space for British servicemen to relax and to get together with their family while they were on leave. Built on the premise of a ""home away from home"" "This plaque was built by former British servicemen in memory of the founder of the Sandes Soldiers Home in Singapore, Miss Kathleen Leslie Symes. The Home, orignally located at Portsdown Road where The Temasek Club used to be, was opened in 1949. Built on the premise of a ""home away from home""
